content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is neat, fast, easy to understand, and simple for beginners

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Yep, this clash is quite simple in languages with native sort by function. The formatting looks concise and good.
Bold <<series>> <<city>> and <<salary>> in the input description to make it easier and quicker for people to make what the input is. Otherwise lgtm and nice clash!
Please add a whitespace after "case of a tie,". Other then that, lgtm!

Goal section
* Please explain that "shortest length" refers to the cities' names.

* The wording is not clear enough. Please explicitly mention that it is FIRST based on the salary, and THEN IN CASE OF TIES, based on the length of the city's name.

* You may remove the example here as it merely repeats what is shown in the Example section without any elaboration.

Input section
* Please change "Line 2" to "Line 1: An integer".

* Please format n as a [[variable]] (2 times).

* Please format "Line 1" and "Next n lines" in <<bold>>.

* Please add a comma after "the series".

* Please delete a comma in ",,".

Constraints section
* I don't understand the constraint, and it doesn't look like it's a constraint on the inputs. It may be deleted.

Cases
* Please change the cases so that each pair of test and validator are similar but different. No cases should be the same.

Thanks.
Thank you for your feedback. I will modify details and description according to your advices.

Thank you for making the changes. It looks better now.

Here are my comments based on the revised version:

Goal section
* Please add "in case of a tie," between "and" and "that".

* Please change "the city" to "the city's name".

Input section
* Please add "(an integer)" after "the salary".

Thanks.
